With international experience in Canada, the United States, and Colombia as an operations and logistics professional, I have been able to establish a career that is centered on process optimization, service efficiency, and team leadership towards success. My experience relied on critical thinking, strategic planning, and adapting to complex operating conditions. During the last years, I had control over the logistics processes, managed cross-functional teams, and introduced data-driven solutions that reinforced performance and customer satisfaction.
I am currently pursuing a Master of Business Administration at the University of Canada West, and I am deepening my knowledge in the field of supply chain, project management, and business analytics. I am looking to incorporate technology and data intelligence in the operations decisions to achieve sustainable growth and innovation. I am proud of my ability to promote cooperation, the pursuit of excellence, and responsibility in any team that I am in, and make sure that the business goals are realized effectively and in a sustainable way.

title: Projects & Case Studies
text:
Projects & Case Studies
I carried out a diagnosis on the health-tourism industry of the Metropolitan Area of Bucaramanga. The background of my work was an analysis of the competitive advantages, market demand, and operational problems in the region based on surveys, interviews, and data on the sector. The research was able to find the structure gaps in the service coordination, international promotion, and standardized service packages.
The results presented useful recommendations to local institutions and service providers, for planning purposes, and the potential clients to be reached. As this sector presented opportunities to be a potential enhancer of regional development.
Ariza Arias, A. J., & Escobar Luna, J. F. (2015). Diagnosis of health tourism in the Metropolitan Area of Bucaramanga (Undergraduate thesis, Universidad Industrial de Santander). .
